content.description: Did this yesterday while I was here, but I'm sure this has been done before so if anyone knows the name/FA let me know!Sit start with a low right hand and a higher left hand pocket with feet wherever. Traverse right onto the large shelf until the crux which requires getting a heel up and reaching for some crimps that look worse than they are. Finish by traversing the lip back left to an easy topout above the start, or for a harder variation you can mantle the top with the help of a hidden crack (requires cleaning to actually be used).
content.protection: Flat landing, one or two pads is enough
content.location: Right on the backside of the Whale Boulder. Looking at Are You Ready For Love walk left around the boulder and you'll see it.

content.description: Starts to the face just right of Crocodile Rock. Good family friendly Boulder that someone of any skill can try.
content.location: Starts just to the right of crocodile rock. Start holds Are close comprsession.

content.description: low start with decent feet. After you make the first left hand move you need to hand heel match with your right hand.
content.protection: One or two pads at most
content.location: The front side of The Whale BoulderÂ

content.description: A fun variation that adds a huge deadpoint or dyno to the lip from the good holds on the rail, tops out directly above, using the crack a few feet back from the lip.
Nice line up a crack. Another good warm up. follow up the crack until it makes sense to go right to the arete. Very easy top out.
content.protection: 2 pads and maybe a spotter for newer climbers
content.location: the first crack on the left side of The Whale Boulder.

content.description: The Boulder on the left of the path coming from the parking lot.
